Articles.Content:
Just wondering : What's your favorite mod, and why ?

My favorite is Outer Planets Mod, because it's really well-made and it should be in the stock game.
Kerbal Engineer, for the same reasons.

I use roughly 25 mods, but if i'd have to pick a favourite i think I'm gonna have to say Navyfish's Docking Indicator because of its elegance in simplicity, usefulness, and appealing design.

Of the more complex mods I'd say FAR or KAS. TAC-LS + Deadly Reentry is also a good candidate

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-05T14:50:00Z" title="04/05/2015 02:50  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 5, 2015</time> by jarmund**

Real Solar System for difficulty

Engineer for Data

Krag's and/or Outer Planets Pack (wish they weren't as glitchy) for exploration

FAR/DR for 1.0 practice

And my favorite mod of all time is infact RSS, I just don't use it alot because it's really hard.

- - - Updated - - -

Real Solar System for difficulty

Engineer for Data

Krag's and/or Outer Planets Pack (wish they weren't as glitchy) for exploration

FAR/DR for 1.0 practice

And my favorite mod of all time is infact RSS, I just don't use it alot because it's really hard.
Kerbal Engineer Redux, because i'm too lazy to calculate everything by hand, but I still want to know what the heck i'm doing.
Kerbal Alarm Clock. I never get those interplanetary transfers right in stock!
Interstellar... It allow to use fancy technologies not so unrealistic and really beautiful...

Distance Objects Enhancement and 5th Horsemen's Skybox. 

Seeing objects in orbit as you do in real life is just the most amazing thing. Seeing my CSM in orbit above me on the surface of the Moon and going "there's my ride home." There's a feeling that provides that can't be described in words. 

Immersive is a good start I suppose.
KCS++ hands down I love it so much having a awesome space sation for me is so fun!
